resources.name: Create user
resources.description:
Create a user.

### Payload keys:

| Name      | Type   | Description                     | Details                         |
| --------- | ------ | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| name      | string | Full name of the user           |                                 |
| cpf       | string | CPF number of the user          | Formated like `XXX.XXX.XXX-XX`  |
| password  | string | Password of the user            |                                 |
| type      | string | Type of the user                | `COMMON` or `SELLER`            |


```response:201
{
	"id": 1,
	"name": "Guilherme",
	"cpf": "123.456.789-10",
	"email": "guilherme@mail.com",
	"type": "COMMON",
	"balance": 0.0
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error              | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **400 Bad Request**      | InvalidUserDto     | Missing or invalid payload keys and/or values  |
| **409 Conflict**         | CpfAlreadyInUse    | Email already in use                           |
| **409 Conflict**         | EmailAlreadyInUse  | Cpf already in use                             |

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: This header specifies that we're sending JSON to the server.

resources.name: Users
resources.description:
The User object is defined by:

| Field         | Type   | Description                     |
| ------------- | ------ | ------------------------------- |
| id            | string | User unique identifier          |
| name          | string | Full name of the user	         |
| cpf           | string | CPF number of the user          |
| password      | string | Password of the user            |
| type          | string | Type of the user                |
| balance       | number | Total balance of the user       |

### Endpoints

| Method | Route                       | Description                                                   |
| ------ | --------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| POST   | /users                      | Create a user.								                                 |
| GET    | /users                      | List all registered users.                                    |
| GET    | /users/:user_id             | Retrieve a user using his ID as a route parameter.            |
| PUT    | /users/:user_id             | Update a user using his ID as a route parameter.              |
| POST   | /users/:user_id/deposit     | Deposit a value to a user using his ID as a route parameter.  |
| DELETE | /users/:user_id             | Delete a user using his ID as a route parameter.              |

resources.name: transactions-management documentation
resources.description:
## Description
This is the documentation for the [transactions-management API](https://transactions-management-backend.onrender.com)!

This documentation has two environments - **Documentation and Insomnia variables**. You can switch between environments using the select box in the top left corner of the page.

If you are curious, you can **access our GitHubs and see how we built this magnifique application**: [**Backend repository**](https://github.com/guilhermeprevedamilek/transactions-management-backend/) ðŸ˜‰

resources.name: Read all users
resources.description:
List all registered users.

```response:200
[
	{
		"id": 1,
		"name": "Guilherme",
		"cpf": "123.456.789-10",
		"email": "guilherme@mail.com",
		"type": "COMMON",
		"balance": 0.0
	}
]
```

### Possible errors:

None, the max that could happen is return an empty list.

resources.name: Retrieve user
resources.description:
Retrieve a user using his ID as a route parameter.

```response:200
{
	"id": 1,
	"name": "Guilherme",
	"cpf": "123.456.789-10",
	"email": "guilherme@mail.com",
	"type": "COMMON",
	"balance": 0.0
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error              | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **404 Not Found**        | UserNotFound       | User not found                                 |

resources.name: Update user
resources.description:
Update a user using his ID as a route parameter.

### Payload keys:

| Name      | Type   | Description                     | Details                         |
| --------- | ------ | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| name      | string | Full name of the user           |                                 |
| cpf       | string | CPF number of the user          | Formated like XXX.XXX.XXX-XX    |
| password  | string | Password of the user            |                                 |
| type      | string | Type of the user                | COMMON or SELLER                |

```response:200
{
	"id": 1,
	"name": "Not Guilherme Anymore",
	"cpf": "109.876.543-21",
	"email": "notguilhermeanymore@mail.com",
	"type": "COMMON",
	"balance": 0.0
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error              | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **404 Not Found**        | UserNotFound       | User not found                                 |
| **400 Bad Request**      | InvalidUserDto     | Missing or invalid payload keys and/or values  |
| **409 Conflict**         | CpfAlreadyInUse    | Email already in use                           |
| **409 Conflict**         | EmailAlreadyInUse  | Cpf already in use                             |

resources.name: Create deposit
resources.description:
Deposit a value to a user using his ID as a route parameter.

### Payload keys:

| Name      | Type   | Description                     |
| --------- | ------ | ------------------------------- |
| value     | number | Deposit value                   |


### Response example:

```response:201
{
	"id": 1,
	"name": "Not Guilherme Anymore",
	"cpf": "109.876.543-21",
	"email": "notguilhermeanymore@mail.com",
	"type": "COMMON",
	"balance": 120.0
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error              | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **404 Not Found**        | UserNotFound       | User not found                                 |
| **400 Bad Request**      | InvalidDepositDto  | Missing or invalid payload keys and/or values  |

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: This header specifies that we're sending JSON to the server.

resources.name: Delete user
resources.description:
Delete a user using his ID as a route parameter.

### Response example:

```response:204
No content
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error              | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **404 Not Found**        | UserNotFound       | User not found                                 |

resources.name: Create transaction
resources.description:
Create a transaction between users.

### Payload keys:

| Name      | Type   | Description                     |
| --------- | ------ | ------------------------------- |
| value     | number | Transaction value               |
| payer     | number | Payer unique identifier (id)    |
| payee     | number | Payee unique identifier (id)    |

### Response example:

```response:201
{
	"id": 1,
	"payer": {
		"id": 1,
		"name": "Not Guilherme Anymore",
		"cpf": "109.876.543-21",
		"email": "notguilhermeanymore@mail.com",
		"type": "COMMON",
		"balance": 20.0
	},
	"payee": {
		"id": 2,
		"name": "Preveda",
		"cpf": "101.928.374-65",
		"email": "preveda@mail.com",
		"type": "SELLER",
		"balance": 100.0
	},
	"value": 100.0,
	"date": "2023-03-01T01:39:30.047+00:00"
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code                 | Error                      | Description                                    |
| -------------------------- | -------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **400 Bad Request**        | InvalidTransactionDto      | Missing or invalid payload keys and/or values  |
| **404 Not Found**          | PayerNotFound              | Payer not found                                |
| **404 Not Found**          | PayeeNotFound              | Payee not found                                |
| **403 Forbidden**          | InvalidUserType            | SELLER type users can not send money           |
| **403 Forbidden**          | BalanceNotSufficient       | Payer balance not sufficient                   |
| **401 Unauthorized**       | TransactionNotAuthorized   | Transaction not authorized                     |
| **424 Failed Dependency**  | TransactionNotConfirmed    | Confirmation email was not sent and the balances were reversed                |

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: This header specifies that we're sending JSON to the server.

resources.name: Transactions
resources.description:
The Transaction object is defined by:

| Field         | Type   | Description                     |
| ------------- | ------ | ------------------------------- |
| id            | string | Transaction unique identifier   |
| value         | number | Transaction value               |
| payer         | user   | Payer of the transaction        |
| payee         | user   | Payee of the transaction        |
| date          | date   | Date of the Transaction         |

### Endpoints

| Method | Route                          | Description                                                   |
| ------ | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| POST   | /transactions                  | Create a transaction between users.                           |
| GET    | /transactions/:transaction_id  | Retrieve a transaction using his ID as a route parameter.     |

resources.name: Retrieve transaction
resources.description:
Retrieve a transaction using his ID as a route parameter.

### Response example:

```response:200
{
    "id": 1,
    "payer": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Not Guilherme Anymore",
        "cpf": "109.876.543-21",
        "email": "notguilhermeanymore@mail.com",
        "type": "COMMON",
        "balance": 20.0
    },
    "payee": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Preveda",
        "cpf": "101.928.374-65",
        "email": "preveda@mail.com",
        "type": "SELLER",
        "balance": 100.0
    },
    "value": 100.0,
    "date": "2023-03-01T01:39:30.047+00:00"
}
```

### Possible errors:

| Error code               | Error                     | Description                                    |
| ------------------------ | ------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **404 Not Found**        | TransactionNotFound       | Transaction not found                          |
